content.description: Stand start with an incut left hand edge and a sloper-jug on the arete. From there, work the thin feet, gain a high left hand edge, work through the right hand slopers, then work around the arete by reaching the diagonal rail edges, and top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads should work fine, the landing is good, but slightly sloping.
content.location: It climbs the blunt south facing arete on Moandavia.

content.description:
Segosilly climbs a lowball overhang on pinches, underclings, and edges. Despite its small size, the movement is fantastic!

Sit start with a right hand pinch/mini-edge and a low, left hand thumb-mantle. From there, pull up to a left hand undercling, bump the right hand to a gaston-pinch, then move the right again to a two-finger crimp/sloper edge, arrange the feet and hit the lip with the right hand, bump the left to the big undercling to prevent the swing, match hands on the lip, throw a heel over, and top it out.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads, as the landing consists of a rock pile. Nevertheless, the landing is quite good with pads resting atop them.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Moandavia.

climbs.name: Right Place at the Wrong Time

content.description: Stand start matched on the high shelf. From there, work up and left using a right heel hook, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's west face.

content.description: Sit start matched on the shelf. From there, use the diagonal shelf and edge to gain the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's west face.

content.description:
Sit start with a right hand pinch/mini-edge and a low left hand mantle. From there, pull up to a left hand two-finger edge, cross over with a right hand gaston, reach the intermediate shelf, gain the lip, and top it out.

As a note, I had to use a cheater pad to reach the start pinch.
content.protection: A pad will work fine, the landing is good, but there are few rocks.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Moandavia.
